dialogue.speaker: archivist-lumina
dialogue.text: Lumina watches you. Her eyes drop to the crystalline cover in your hand, still faintly glowing with your inscribed emotions. Her expression shifts to calculated knowing. "Careful, Archivist," she murmurs, stepping between you and the prying eyes of the junior staff. "You haven't learned to control your connection to the Book."

dialogue.speaker: archivist-lumina
dialogue.text: She taps the cover of your book with two of the six, slender fingers on her hand. "The Book of Passage does not merely record history; it is linked to your essence. In these early stages, before you learn to discipline your mind, it will transcribe everything. Your history, your observations... and your vulnerabilities."

dialogue.speaker: archivist-lumina
dialogue.text: She leans in slightly, her tone shifting to a guarded hush. "Keep it close. And to mostâ€”keep it closed." She chooses her next words carefully. "Tension in the Kethaneum has become sharp. You do not want your doubts read like a public notice by those looking for weakness."

dialogue.speaker: archivist-lumina
dialogue.text: Satisfied that you understand, she straightens up, returning to her professional persona. "Now, Archivist, to business." A wry smile graces her lips. "Yes, I said Archivist. Do not forget that you have earned that distinction. You are here to do a job. Not sightsee. You work here now."

dialogue.speaker: archivist-lumina
dialogue.text: "The modernization efforts have disrupted more than transits. The Archives themselves are straining. Words are being lost, meanings scrambled. We need every available archivist working to catalog and stabilize the texts." She glances toward the infinite corridors. "Venture deeper into the archives and the Kethaneum will bring the wounded texts to you. Do not worry. You know how to catalog the texts. This is what you have studied for. May knowledge smile on you and our combined efforts elevate you."

dialogue.speaker: archivist-lumina
dialogue.text: With that, Lumina sends you out into the archives.
